name: St. Mechtilde of Magdeburg

locations.description: Beguine and later Cistercian nun in Magdeburg, known for her mystical work 'The Flowing Light of the Godhead'

summary: Mechtilde of Magdeburg was a German Beguine and later Cistercian nun who wrote 'The Flowing Light of the Godhead', one of the most important works of medieval German mysticism. Her writings influenced later mystics including Meister Eckhart and influenced the development of German mystical theology.
